intro: Anthyllis variegata, commonly known as the variable carline thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky, or limestone soils. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often variegated with white or yellow markings, giving it its common name. Anthyllis variegata is part of the legume family and has the ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic bacteria in its root nodules.
